name: Modules.BLE.PeripheralManager
summary: An object that manages and advertises peripheral services exposed by this app.

events.name: didUpdateState
events.summary: Fired whenever the state of the module's internal peripheral manager changes.

properties.name: state
properties.summary: An integer describing the state of the module's internal peripheral manager. See the MANAGER_STATE_* constants.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: didPublishL2CAPChannel
events.summary: Tells the delegate that the peripheral manager created a listener for incoming L2CAP channel connections.

properties.name: psm
properties.summary: The Protocol/Service Multiplexer (PSM) of the published channel.

properties.name: errorCode
properties.summary: The error code; only present if an error occurred.

properties.name: errorDomain
properties.summary: The error domain; only present if an error occurred..

properties.name: advertisementData
properties.summary: An object (dictionary) containing the data being advertised at the time the application was terminated by the system. See the startAdvertising method for more detail.

properties.name: services
properties.summary: Array of uuids of Services

properties.name: service
properties.summary: An object representing the service that was added.

events.name: didSubscribeToCharacteristic
events.summary: This event is fired when a central configures a characteristic to notify or indicate. It should be used as a cue to start sending updates as the characteristic value changes.

properties.name: central
properties.summary: An object representing the central that subscribed.

properties.name: characteristic
properties.summary: An object representintg the characteristic to which the central subscribed.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: didUnsubscribeFromCharacteristic
events.summary: This event is fired when a central removes notifications/indications from a characteristic.

properties.name: central
properties.summary: An object representing the central that unsubscribed.

properties.name: characteristic
properties.summary: An object representintg the characteristic from which the central unsubscribed.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: didReceiveReadRequest
events.summary: This event is fired when the module's internal peripheral manager receives a read request.

properties.name: request
properties.summary: An object representing the request.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: didReceiveWriteRequests
events.summary: This event is fired when the module's internal peripheral manager receives a write request for one or more characteristics.
events.description: For every invocation of this method, respondToRequest should be called exactly once. If the requests parameter contains multiple requests, they must be treated as an atomic unit. If the execution of one of the requests would cause a failure, the request and error reason should be provided and none of the requests should be executed.

properties.name: request
properties.summary: request objects describing the incoming write request

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: readyToUpdateSubscribers
events.summary: This event is fired when the module's internal peripheral manager receives a write request for one or more characteristics.This event is fired after a failed call to updateValue, when the module's internal peripheral manager is again ready to send characteristic value updates.

methods.name: addService
methods.summary: Publishes a service and any of its associated characteristics and characteristic descriptors to the local GATT database.

parameters.name: characteristics
parameters.summary: A list of characteristics of a service.

parameters.name: primary
parameters.summary: The type of the service (primary or secondary).

methods.name: publishL2CAPChannel
methods.summary: Attempts to open an L2CAP channel to the peripheral using the supplied Protocol/Service Multiplexer (PSM).

parameters.name: encryptionRequired
parameters.summary: The bool can be true if the service requires the link to be encrypted before a stream can be established. false if the service can be used over an unsecured link.

methods.name: removeAllServices
methods.summary: Removes all published services from the local GATT database.

methods.name: removeService
methods.summary: Removes a specified published service from the local GATT database.

parameters.name: service
parameters.summary: Object of service you want to remove.

methods.name: respondToRequest
methods.summary: Used to respond to request(s) received via the didReceiveReadRequest or didReceiveWriteRequests event.

parameters.name: request
parameters.summary: The request to which the peripheral is responding.

parameters.name: result
parameters.summary: The result code; see the ATT_ERROR* constants.

methods.name: setDesiredConnectionLatency
methods.summary: Sets the desired connection latency for an existing connection on the module's internal peripheral manager.
methods.description: Connection latency changes are not guaranteed, so the resultant latency may vary. If a desired latency is not set, the latency chosen by the central at the time of connection establishment will be used. Typically, it is not necessary to change the latency.

methods.name: startAdvertising
methods.summary: Instructs the module's internal peripheral manager to start advertising.
methods.description: Important: You must call the initPeripheralManager function first! Supported advertising data types are localName and serviceUUIDs. When in the foreground, an application can utilize up to 28 bytes of space in the initial advertisement data for any combination of the supported advertising data types. If this space is used up, there are an additional 10 bytes of space in the scan response that can be used only for the local name. Note that these sizes do not include the 2 bytes of header information that are required for each new data type. Any service UUIDs that do not fit in the allotted space will be added to a special "overflow" area, and can only be discovered by an iOS device that is explicitly scanning for them. While an application is in the background, the local name will not be used and all service UUIDs will be placed in the "overflow" area.

methods.name: stopAdvertising
methods.summary: Instructs the module's internal peripheral manager to stop advertising.

methods.name: unpublishL2CAPChannel
methods.summary: The service PSM to be removed from the system.

parameters.name: PSM
parameters.summary: The PSM of the channel along with we can close the particular channel.

methods.name: updateValue
methods.summary: Instructs the module's internal peripheral manager to send an updated characteristic value to one or more centrals, via a notification or indication.

parameters.name: centrals
parameters.summary: The list of centrals that need to be updated. If not specified, all subscribed centrals will be updated.

returns.summary: True if the update could be sent, or false if the underlying transmit queue is full. If false was returned, the readyToUpdateSubscribers event will be fired once space has become available, and the update should be re-sent if so desired.

properties.name: isAdvertising
properties.summary: Whether or not the the module's internal peripheral manager is currently advertising data.

properties.name: peripheralManagerState
properties.summary: State of the module's internal peripheral manager. Its value is one of the MANAGER_STATE_* constants.

properties.name: restoredPeripheralManagerIdentifier
properties.summary: string the restoration identifier for a peripheral manager object. this is the same string you assigned to the restoreIdentifier parameter of the initPeripheralManager function.
